attributes.action: Allow Tattoo/piercing studios and hair/beauty to open as soon as possible
attributes.additional_details:
Can be booking only, deep clean In between clients, easy tracking
Protective gear can be worn by both client and worker 
Places of higher risk and higher footfall are open with less provisions in place to stop the spread

A lot of people are affected negatively financially and mentally leading to depression and suicide
(Not enough backing or support)

When the government announced their reasons for the increase in positive cases, none of the industries above were mentioned or even came close.
attributes.background:
To allow the industries listed above (tattoo, piercing, hair, beauty(cosmetic) ) to re open as soon as possible 

Lack of support from the government is causing huge problems in these industries (business’ closing due to the grant not covering all the months rent etc..) and to the people mentally.

rejection.details:
On 22 February the Government published its Spring 2021 Covid-19 roadmap, which stated that close contact services would be allowed to resume in Step 2, no earlier than 12 April: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021/covid-19-response-spring-2021

We could accept a petition calling for this date to be brought forward, but it would need to be clear when you want these sectors to be allowed to resume operations.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep the beauty industry open: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554478
